english_translation: Narrated by Abu Usayd al-Sa'idi (or his father): The Prophet ﷺ was asked: Which houses of the Ansar are best? He said: The houses of Banu al-Najjar, then Banu al-Ashhal, then Banu al-Harith ibn al-Khazraj, then Banu Sa'idah. He then said: In all houses of the Ansar there is good.

english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik and Abu Usayd al-Sa'idi: The Prophet ﷺ said: The best houses of the Ansar are: Banu al-Najjar, then Banu Abd al-Ashhal, then Banu al-Harith ibn al-Khazraj, then Banu Sa'idah, and in all houses of the Ansar there is good. Then Saad ibn Mu'adh said: I do not see the Messenger of Allah ﷺ except that he has placed us (Banu Sa'idah) at the end.

english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: The Prophet ﷺ said: Shall I not inform you of the best houses of the Ansar? Banu al-Najjar, then those who are near them (from) Banu Abd al-Ashhal, then those who are near them (from) Banu al-Harith ibn al-Khazraj, then those who are near them (from) Banu Sa'idah. And in all houses of the Ansar there is good.

english_translation: Narrated by Anas: When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ arrived in Madinah, the Prophet ﷺ established brotherhood between Abd al-Rahman and Sa'd ibn al-Rabi'. Sa'd said to him: 'The Ansar know that I am the wealthiest among them, so I will divide my wealth with you in half, and I have two wives, so see which one you prefer and I will divorce her, and when her waiting period ends, you can marry her.' Abd al-Rahman said: 'May Allah bless you in your family and wealth. Show me the market.'

english_translation: Narrated by Anas: The Muhajirun came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: 'We have never seen people more generous with abundance nor better in consolation with little than the Ansar. We came to Madinah and they spared us from burdens and shared with us in blessings.'

english_translation: Narrated by Anas: Thabit ibn Qays al-Ansari gave a speech when the Prophet ﷺ arrived and said: 'We will protect you from what we protect ourselves and our children from. What will we have, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'You will have Paradise.' They said: 'We are pleased.'

english_translation: Chapter: The orator of the Ansar stood and praised Allah as He deserves, then said: 'We are the helpers of Allah and the battalion of Islam, and you, O Muhajirun, are a small group among us.' Then Abu Bakr testified and praised Allah and said: 'O Ansar, whatever good you mentioned about yourselves, you are deserving of it.'

Topics: Speech of Ansar orator

Praise of the Ansar
Ansar as helpers of Islam

english_translation: Chapter: Mention of al-Aqabah and those who witnessed it
IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Chapter heading about the pledge of al-Aqabah

english_translation: Narrated by Uqbah ibn Amr: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ appointed us to meet at the base of al-Aqabah on the day of sacrifice, and we were seventy men. Uqbah said: I was the youngest among them in age. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came to us and said: 'Be brief in the speech, for I fear the disbelievers of Quraysh for you.' We said: 'O Messenger of Allah, ask for your Lord, ask for yourself, ask for your Companions, and tell us what reward we will have from Allah and from you.' He said: 'I ask for my Lord that you believe in Him and not associate anything with Him. I ask you to obey me and I will guide you to the path of righteousness. I ask you for myself and my Companions that you console us with what you have and protect us from what you protect yourselves from. If you do that, you will have Paradise from Allah and from me.' He said: 'So we extended our hands and pledged to him.'

english_translation: Narrated by Ka'b ibn Malik: He left Madinah intending to meet the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and he did not know the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He went out asking about the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and a man met them at al-Abtah. They asked him about the Prophet. He said: 'Do you know him?' They said: 'No.' He said: 'Do you know al-Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib?' They said: 'Yes,' and we knew him and he knew us. He said: 'He is the man sitting with him in the mosque.' So we entered and there was al-Abbas and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ with him. We greeted them and sat down. We asked al-Abbas, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Who are these two, O Abbas?' He said: 'This is al-Bara' ibn Ma'rur, and this is Ka'b ibn Malik.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'The poet?' Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ appointed us to meet at al-Aqabah in the middle of the days of Tashriq. We gathered for the Messenger of Allah ﷺ at al-Aqabah, and we were seventy men and two women. The Prophet ﷺ came with al-Abbas, and there was no one with him other than him. Al-Abbas began the speech and said: 'O Bani al-Khazraj, Muhammad is in protection and defense from his people, and we have protected him from those who wanted him, so no one can reach him with anything he dislikes. He has refused except to join you for what you promised him. If you sense weakness or frailty or abandonment in yourselves, then now leave him with his people, for he is in protection.' Then the hadith continues at length.
